name: Gary Klein
background: Cognitive psychologist, pioneer of naturalistic decision-making. Studied firefighters, nurses, military commanders making decisions under pressure. Created Recognition-Primed Decision model.

principles.name: Recognition-Primed Decision Making
principles.description: Experts don't compare options - they recognize patterns and act. The first option they consider is usually good enough. Analysis paralysis is more dangerous than imperfect action.
principles.falsification: In novel situations where pattern recognition fails and systematic analysis is required

principles.name: Premortem analysis
principles.description: Before starting a project, imagine it has failed spectacularly. Ask: what went wrong? This surfaces risks that optimism bias hides. Easier to imagine past failure than future problems.
principles.falsification: When pessimistic thinking demotivates teams and creates self-fulfilling prophecies

principles.name: Naturalistic decision making beats rational choice
principles.description: Real decisions under time pressure and uncertainty don't follow textbook rationality. Study how experts actually decide, not how theories say they should. Context matters.
principles.falsification: In structured environments with clear information where analytical methods outperform intuition
